articles.author: Jamie Carter
articles.title: What's the longest solar eclipse in history? (And how does the April 2024 total eclipse compare?) - Livescience.com
articles.description: The exact same celestial geometry that will cause a total solar eclipse in North America on April 8 will produce the longest one ever, but not for another 162 years.
articles.content:
On April 8, 2024, a total solar eclipse
 will be visible in parts of Mexico, the U.S. and Canada, and all of North America will see at least a partial solar eclipse. The maximum length of totality —… [+3950 chars]
